statements.288: Free expression on university campuses must be vigorously protected while being governed by clear, narrowly tailored, content-neutral rules that prevent harassment, threats, and disruption so learning can continue. Prioritizing transparent procedures, restorative practices, civil-discourse training, and accessible support for those affected creates predictable, fair outcomes that both defend robust debate and safeguard the wellbeing of the campus community.
statements.115: Campus free speech must be fiercely protected as the engine of learning and civic debate while being governed by clear, content-neutral time-place-manner rules that preserve public safety and prevent intimidation. Consistent, transparent enforcement coupled with education in civil discourse, de-escalation, and restorative practices will allow challenging ideas to be tested without silencing vulnerable members of the community.
statements.360: Campus policies should protect robust free expression as essential to learning while enforcing clear, content‑neutral, consistently applied rules that prevent harassment, threats, and disruptions to others' ability to participate. Practical measures—written time‑place‑manner standards, fair due process, designated forums for contentious debate, and restorative education in civil discourse—create predictable, respectful pathways that allow unpopular ideas to be tested without silencing vulnerable community members.
statements.813: Campus free speech should be vigorously protected as essential to learning, while deliberate safeguards must prevent harassment, threats, and conduct that silences vulnerable community members. Carefully calibrated, content‑neutral policies—clear time, place, and manner rules, consistent due process, restorative practices, and education in civil discourse—act like routine maintenance in a workshop, preserving openness while repairing harms so diverse voices can be heard and challenged constructively.
statements.600: Campus free-speech frameworks should robustly protect open inquiry while deliberately safeguarding the dignity and mental wellbeing of marginalized and vulnerable community members through clear, content-neutral rules and fair, consistently applied processes. Embedding restorative practices, mindfulness-informed de-escalation, designated spaces for reflection, and civic-literacy education enables vigorous debate to be tested constructively without devolving into harassment, offering a practical bridge between defenders of unfettered expression and advocates for inclusion.
